{{cpp/title|indirectly_copyable}}
{{cpp/iterator/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=iterator|since=c++20|1=
template&lt; class In, class Out &gt;
concept indirectly_copyable =
    std::indirectly_readable&lt;In&gt; &amp;&amp;
    std::indirectly_writable&lt;Out, std::iter_reference_t&lt;In&gt;&gt;;
}}

The {{tt|indirectly_copyable}} concept specifies the relationship between an {{lconcept|indirectly_readable}} type and a type that is {{lconcept|indirectly_writable}}. The {{tt|indirectly_writable}} type must be able to directly copy the object that the {{tt|indirectly_readable}} type references.
